page.title: 15CHURCHES AND CHAPELS
page.content:
There is a small church at Finghall dedicated to St. Andrew.The first church was probably built in the 1100's,but only small parts of this early church remain.The style is Early English.It has a small tower.
The living is now combined with the livings of Hauxwell and Spennithorne. The present rector lives at Spennithorne.About 120 people can attend service.
There is also a small Wesleyan Chapel at Finghall,erected in 1909 to replace an older smaller chapel,now in ruins.
Constable Burton Wesleyan Methodist Chapel was built in 1905.It is still in use today and is situated in Mill Lane.
